summary: The document is a memorandum detailing the issuance of a CIA Identification Card under an alias to a TFW employee, an exception to the usual policy for State Department integrees, due to the employee's specific position and experience. It outlines procedures for handling inquiries about the employee and includes a request for the reassignment of Harold F. Swenson, providing insights into CIA's administrative and security processes. The mention of the President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992 indicates its release was part of a declassification effort.
key_findings: The CIA issued an alias identification card to an employee, showcasing procedures for cover identities.
An exception to the policy against alias identifications for State Department integrees was made, demonstrating flexibility in security protocols under certain conditions.
Insight into the CIA's administrative processes, including personnel actions and security measures, is provided.
The document's reference to the President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992 suggests its release was part of a broader declassification effort.
keywords: President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992
